page.title: 08CRANHAM CHURCH
page.content: Our church is about 200 yards down the road from our school. It dates back to the Norman times because a Norman arch was found above the entrance there. There is are two shields, one shield has a pair of sheep shears. There is a church clock facing North. There are some very old yew trees, there are seven of them and they are shaped in cones. In the churchyard there are plenty of table vaults, Joseph Alexander Horlick's family vault is there, he was the man who invented the drink. You can open that vault and go exploring. There are graves dating back to the 1600s. The vicar has a cloak for special occasions with gold thread. The church is a C. of E.,and can seat a congregation of about 80,having been enlarged in 1926.
